title: Fairfield Inn Serif Font
content:
Hello again folks. Need some more help finding the font in the Fairfield Inn by Marriott logo (just the relevant portion is shown here):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110022648im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fairfield_6473.jpg)

I don't think the _Fairfield_ and _Inn_ are the same (the serifs look a little different, and the _Inn_ looks heavier as well), but just posting the _Inn_ may not be particularly helpful. The _Inn_ is all I really need to replicate, though.

Assistance is most appreciated!
author: iskippy227

comments.content:
FAIRFIELD is based on Goudy

Not sure which version...
Customized Goudy Old Style. The INN could be the small caps.

Based on the suggestion of Goudy, I played around with it in Illustrator this morning. When attempting to change the fill colour, I accidentally added a stroke to some type I set in Goudy Extra Bold, and, what do you know, it came pretty darn close. I should be able to play with the stroke and tracking and get it pretty close to perfect.

Thanks for setting me on the right path!

Not that recreating a logo isn't isn't a fun and educational exercise, but if you just need the artwork...

[http://brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query\_id=31658486&page=1&brand\_id=59072](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110022648/http:/brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query_id=31658486&page=1&brand_id=59072 "http://brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query\_id=31658486&page=1&brand\_id=59072")

"but if you just need the artwork..."

Always thought it would be good to have a resource like this - didn't realize it was already there. Thanks for the link.

The Fairfield Inn sample there is totally different though.

That one must be an older one. The second one on that page is the one they currently use.

My problem was that my client is a Fairfield _Inn & Suites_ location, and, try as I might, I couldn't find a version of this logo (hence needing to know what they used for _Inn_ so I could add _& Suites_). I have found BotW indispensable in the past, though, and didn't even think to check there first.
